macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Futures Rise Amid AI Chip Concerns and Earnings Anticipation
items.summary: S&P 500 futures edged up 0.2%, Nasdaq 100 futures climbed 0.4%, and Dow futures hovered near flatline on February 3, 2026, building on Monday's rally. Nvidia shares slid nearly 3% due to OpenAI delaying a $100B deal over chip dissatisfaction, while Palantir surged 6% on strong Q4 results.

items.title: S&P 500 Nears Record High After Monday's 0.5% Gain and Market Rotation
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.5% to 6,976.44 on Monday, just below its record, snapping a three-day losing streak; Dow gained 1.1% to 49,407.66, Nasdaq up 0.6% to 23,592.11. Small-caps via Russell 2000 advanced 1%, signaling rotation from tech to value stocks.

items.title: US Stocks Climb as Gold and Silver Prices Fall Sharply
items.summary: US stocks rebounded Monday with S&P 500 up 0.5%, Dow +1.1%, Nasdaq +0.6%, led by computer storage, airlines, and cruise operators amid easing oil prices. Gold and silver tumbled further after recent volatility, while oil dropped over 4% on reports of Iran-US talks.

items.title: US Government Partial Shutdown Postpones Key Jobs Report and Data Releases
items.summary: Upcoming data including Friday's monthly jobs report delayed due to US partial government shutdown, potentially impacting Fed rate decisions. Strong manufacturing data pushed 10-year Treasury yield to 4.28%, signaling possible Fed pause on rate cuts.

items.title: Heavy S&P 500 Earnings Week Ahead with AMD, Amazon, Alphabet Reporting
items.summary: Over 100 S&P 500 firms report this week, including AMD on Tuesday and Amazon, Alphabet later; focus on AI investments boosting margins after mixed Microsoft results. Investors eye tech earnings for growth evidence amid market rotation.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Slumps to 10-Month Low Above $78,000 Amid Market Volatility
items.summary: Bitcoin prices have fallen to a 10-month low, hovering around $78,000-$80,000 on February 2, 2026, despite bullish long-term outlooks from analysts. Factors include collapsing basis trades around Bitcoin ETFs and recent outflows, though institutional adoption by firms like Morgan Stanley and UBS is expected to drive recovery.

items.title: Bitwise Analyst Predicts Bitcoin Could Reach $1 Million in Next Decade
items.summary: Bitwise Head of Research Ryan Rasmussen highlights catalysts like increasing institutional crypto allocations and ETF inflows from major wirehouses that could push Bitcoin higher, potentially to $1 million over the next decade despite current slump.

items.title: Fundstrat's Tom Lee Sees Crypto Bottoming with Pieces in Place for Rebound
items.summary: Fundstrat's Tom Lee states all pieces are aligning for crypto to bottom now, citing lack of leverage in the industry and positive historical patterns, amid Bitcoin's plunge.

items.title: Bullish News Contrasts Bearish Crypto Markets as Bitcoin Holds On
items.summary: Despite abundant bullish developments, Bitcoin and markets are dropping, with analysts noting positive backdrops like strong ISM manufacturing data beating forecasts at 52.6% versus expected 48.4%.

items.title: Bitcoin Slide Accelerates on Inflation Hawk Fears Rattling Markets
items.summary: Bitcoin's decline intensifies due to fears of inflation hawks, impacting crypto markets as discussed by Circle Squared Alternative Investments' Jeff Sica.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Ai2 Introduces Theorizer for Automatic Theory Synthesis from Scientific Papers
items.summary: Ai2 launched Theorizer, an open-source tool that synthesizes explicit scientific laws from up to 100 papers per query, outputting structured ⟨LAW, SCOPE, EVIDENCE⟩ results with 0.88–0.90 precision. It uses GPT-4.1 for synthesis and runs in 15–30 minutes, improving recall through literature grounding.[2]

items.title: WindFlash AI Highlights RLVR as Revolutionary Breakthrough in AI Inference Scaling
items.summary: Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards (RLVR) emerges as a key advancement providing linear performance gains, surpassing plateauing RLHF returns and shifting focus from pre-training to inference-time scaling.[1]

items.title: NVIDIA's $100 Billion Investment in OpenAI Confirmed in Recent Updates
items.summary: NVIDIA's up to $100 billion investment in OpenAI, announced last September, provides crucial cash and access, noted in the latest AI tech roundup alongside automotive AI developments.[1]

items.title: Xpeng Doubles Down on Physical AI Strategy Despite Robot Demo Failure
items.summary: Xpeng advances its Physical AI for autonomous driving, targeting a 'DeepSeek moment,' even after its Iron humanoid robot fell in a public demo; January sales show Huawei HIMA leading with 57,000 units.[1]

items.title: ThoughtSpot Unveils New Fleet of Agentic AI Systems for Modern Analytics
items.summary: ThoughtSpot introduces agentic systems shifting from passive reporting to active decision-making, as explained by their field chief data and AI officer Jane Smith.[3]

items.title: Debate: AI Achieves Human-Level Intelligence, Per New Analysis
items.summary: Evidence suggests AI has reached human-level machine intelligence as envisioned by Alan Turing, urging preparation for next steps without hype or dread.[2]

items.title: Anthropic Study: AI Tools Reduce Learning Speed and Debugging in Async Programming
items.summary: Anthropic's evaluation shows AI-assisted groups score 50% on quizzes vs. 67% without AI, with largest gaps in debugging; users finish faster but lack comprehension.[2]

items.title: Microsoft's AI Investments Yield Low Copilot Chat Adoption
items.summary: Microsoft invests billions in AI but converts only 3.3% of Copilot Chat users to paid, despite CEO claims of momentum.[7]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass February 2026 Lineup Confirmed with Multiple New Titles
items.summary: Indika joined Xbox Game Pass on February 2 across Ultimate, PC, and Premium tiers, with Final Fantasy II arriving February 3, and upcoming additions including Menace on February 5, High on Life 2 on February 13, and Death Howl on February 19.[1]

items.title: Falcom Confirms Major Game Announcement for February
items.summary: Trails and Ys developer Falcom teases a major game reveal this month, potentially a new Tokyo Xanadu title, amid plans for two releases in 2026 including Trails in the Sky 2nd Chapter.[2]

items.title: Blizzard QA Workers Ratify Union Contract with Microsoft
items.summary: Quality assurance workers at Blizzard have ratified their first union contract with Microsoft, marking a significant labor milestone in the gaming industry.[3]

items.title: Ashes of Creation Developer Intrepid Studios Shuts Down
items.summary: Intrepid Studios, developers of the upcoming MMO Ashes of Creation, has reportedly shut down, impacting the project's future.[3]

items.title: Sword of the Sea Composer Austin Wintory Wins Grammy
items.summary: Composer Austin Wintory won a Grammy award for his work on the video game Sword of the Sea, highlighting recognition for game music.[3]

items.title: Ubisoft Staff Plan Worldwide Strike February 10-12
items.summary: Ubisoft employees will strike globally from February 10-12 over layoffs, project cancellations, and return-to-office mandates amid restructuring.[4]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Oracle Launches Massive $45-50 Billion Bond Sale for Cloud Infrastructure Expansion
items.summary: Oracle is raising $45 billion to $50 billion through debt and equity sales this year to build additional cloud infrastructure capacity. The bond sale kicked off recently amid surging demand for cloud services.

items.title: SanDisk Shares Surge 15% in a Day, Up 180% Year-to-Date After Western Digital Spin-Off
items.summary: SanDisk topped S&P 500 gainers with a 15% rise in the latest session, continuing its strong performance since spinning off from Western Digital last February. The company has climbed over 1700% since the spin-off.

items.title: Nvidia Raises GPU Prices by 10-15% Due to Tariffs and Manufacturing Cost Surges
items.summary: Nvidia has increased prices on nearly all products, with gaming GPUs up 5-10% and others up to 15%, to offset tariffs and rising costs. This follows memory price hikes driven by high demand.

items.title: Tesla Sales Plummet 42% in France Amid Slumping European EV Registrations
items.summary: Tesla sold just 661 cars in France in January, down 42%, as new vehicle registrations for battery EVs dropped sharply in key European markets. This continues a slump from late last year.

items.title: IPVanish Launches Threat Protection Pro Malware Blocker for Disconnected Use
items.summary: VPN provider IPVanish released Threat Protection Pro, a new feature that blocks malware even when not connected to VPN. It aims to enhance user security across devices.

items.title: Two Affordable DJI Drones Leak, Potentially Evading US Ban
items.summary: Leaks reveal two new budget DJI drones that may avoid the US ban on Chinese drones. They target consumer markets with lower price points.

items.title: Windows 11 Desktop Bug Breaks UI for Some Users, Fix Available
items.summary: A Windows 11 bug is causing the entire desktop to malfunction for certain users. Microsoft has released a fix to resolve the issue.

items.title: India Offers Zero Taxes to Foreign Cloud Providers Using Local Data Centers Until 2047
items.summary: India is providing tax incentives with zero taxes until 2047 for foreign cloud providers routing data through Indian data centers. This aims to boost local infrastructure investment.
